content.description: A striking line up an overhanging face curving right. Small delicate moves past the first to second bolts, long reaches and careful feet through the middle, and easy climbing to the anchors.
content.location: Left side of the east face.

climbs.name: HB's Masterpiece
climbs.fa: Dave LePere, John Cardmon, Brad Singer 11-98  F.F.A. Travis McElvany, Dave LePere 1-99

content.description: A Pinnacles test piece up a very steep face. The crux being between the fourth and fifth bolts.
content.location: On the highest formation on the East Face. Bolted line above  The Deadline.

content.description:
This is the short wide gap formed by a block that sits just behind the topout of Kitty Litter.  A bolt protects the entry move, probably intended for the harder steep face, above a dead tree that somewhat obstructs the start.  R merely refers to the mild runout up the easy jugggy arete above the bolt and before getting to place a high piece for the finish.  Mid part of gap probably protectable with a Big Bro if want to lug that in.  This tops out on a big walk-around ledge to connect to Eiger Crack.

Eiger Gap is just a token name for now, instead of yet another Unknown.  Can easily update to its actual name if anyone has the FA info.
content.protection: 1 bolt, 1" to 3" cams, gear anchor. Walk off to climber's right, or step around to the base of Eiger Crack to climb that and adjacent ones as well.
content.location: Located on the left edge of the east face above the topout of Kitty Litter and below Eiger Crack.

content.description: A short, but fun slab. Originally done with only 2 bolts.
content.protection: 3 bolts, bolt anchor with rap rings.
content.location: Slab right of the Eiger Crack.

content.description: A dihedral up a low angled face. Named for the cold conditions during the FA.
content.protection: Very small pieces and a 3 or 4, shared anchor with Eiger Face.
content.location: Above Kitty Litter, the dihedral next to the Eiger Face.

content.description: One of the hardest and most attractive lines at the Pinnacles. Two overhanging blocks the crux being the lower of the two.
content.location: Above the Eiger Crack and below HB's Masterpiece.
